poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The hurst was a shoal on the river of time, A knoll in the tangle of space; The hurt was mortal. The hut was not That place of hushed Resonance, a piano's ribcage, But a clearing hulked and hunched with branches Pleached as lovers' arms might be, Where the two of them humped and huffed. And the hunt was on.
